prompt: Photorealistic macro shot focusing on the identification features of an early 20th-century antique teddy bear. Positioned slightly left of center is a single, worn amber glass eye reflecting soft, directional window light. Adjacent, the coarse texture of faded golden mohair fur is rendered in extreme detail, showing individual strands and patches of wear. A subtle hint of the wood wool (excelsior) stuffing peeks through a carefully stitched repair near the shoulder joint area. Shallow depth of field keeps the eye and fur texture sharp while softly blurring the immediate background. Lighting is soft and natural, emphasizing the textures and aged materials. Professional, informative style suitable for an identification guide. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-teddy-bears-identification-image-1.png

prompt: Photorealistic overhead view capturing an antique teddy bear expert's workbench during an identification process. A well-worn, circa 1920s teddy bear with characteristically long limbs lies centrally on a dark, aged wood surface. Arranged neatly around it are essential identification tools: a vintage brass magnifying glass positioned over the bear's paw pad (as if searching for marks), a cloth measuring tape stretched alongside a limb, tweezers carefully holding a small sample of wood wool stuffing, and an open reference book displaying illustrations of early bear types and joint mechanisms. Bright, even overhead studio lighting ensures clarity and detail across the entire scene. Professional, informative, and meticulously detailed aesthetic. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-teddy-bears-identification-image-2.png

prompt: Photorealistic eye-level wide shot displaying a lineup of four distinct antique teddy bears arranged horizontally on a simple, weathered wooden shelf against a plain, neutral backdrop. The bears represent different eras, showcasing the evolution of design: far left, an early 1900s bear with a pronounced pointed snout, long arms, hump back, and boot button eyes; next, a 1920s classic mohair bear with glass eyes and slightly shorter limbs; then a 1940s bear with a rounder face and plumper body; finally, a 1950s bear with different fur texture and proportions. Even, diffused museum-style lighting illuminates all bears clearly, facilitating comparison of their shapes, materials, and features. Sharp focus across the lineup. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-teddy-bears-identification-image-3.png

prompt: Photorealistic close-up, dramatic focus on a hand wearing white cotton conservation gloves gently pulling back the worn mohair fur on the left ear of a distressed antique teddy bear. Revealed is a tarnished, authentic metal 'button-in-ear' maker's mark (Steiff style), which is the sharp focal point. The texture of the aged fur, the structure of the ear, and the fabric weave of the glove are highly detailed. Very shallow depth of field intensely blurs the rest of the bear's head and the indistinct background. Lighting is tightly focused, like a spotlight or angled lamp, highlighting the button and creating strong contrast, emphasizing the moment of discovery. Detailed macro photography style. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-teddy-bears-identification-image-4.png

prompt: Atmospheric photorealistic wide shot depicting a lone, well-loved antique teddy bear (circa 1910s, faded brown mohair, visible stitched repairs, one ear slightly askew) sitting forlornly on the dusty wooden floorboards of a forgotten attic. Golden hour sunlight streams dramatically through a grimy dormer window located on the upper right of the frame, illuminating swirling dust motes and casting long, soft shadows across the floor. The bear is positioned on the left third of the composition, gazing towards the light source. The background features dimly lit, softly focused elements like cobwebs, old wooden trunks, and stacked boxes, evoking a sense of history and nostalgia. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: antique-teddy-bears-identification-image-5.png
